intro: Coccoloba recurva, commonly known as the coast lantana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of the Caribbean and the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically green and have a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Coccoloba recurva is often found growing along coastal areas and in moist, shaded environments.
